recipe.title: How to Make Chocolate Whipped Cream

procedure.summary: Chill the mixing bowl and whisk ahead of time.
procedure.description: Remove the bowl and whisk from your mixer. Place both into the freezer, and leave them there for 15 to 30 minutes. Skip this step if you are using a food processor; you do not need to chill the bowl of a food processor. Make sure that it is fitted with whisks.

procedure.summary: Add the vanilla extract and dry ingredients into the bowl.
procedure.description: Once the 15 to 30 minutes have passed, take the bowl out of the freezer. Add the vanilla extract, sugar, and cocoa powder. You can use regular or Dutch processed cocoa powder. To make mocha whipped cream, add 1 teaspoon of instant coffee or espresso powder. If you are using a food processor, put the ingredients into the food processor's bowl.

procedure.summary: Stir in 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of the heavy whipping cream.
procedure.description: Use a spoon for this step; don't start up your mixer or food processor just yet. Simply add in 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of heavy whipping cream, then stir until the sugar and cocoa powder dissolve. This will help the cocoa and sugar mix more evenly into the rest of the whipping cream.

procedure.summary: Pour in the rest of the cream and whip until stiff peaks form.
procedure.description: Once the sugar and cocoa powder have dissolved, pour in the rest of the cold, heavy whipping cream. Set up your mixer, and let it whip on medium until the cream forms stiff peaks. This will take 4 to 5 minutes. If you are using a food processor, your whipped cream should be ready in about 3 minutes.
If you won't be using it right away, or if you have any leftovers, cover the whipped cream with plastic wrap, then store it in the fridge. Use it within 3 days.
